item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You don’t forget the face of the person who was your last hope." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Life is a journey. Time is a river. The door is ajar" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"Are you always a smartass?'
Nope. Sometimes I'm asleep." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Of course Evil's afoot. If it had switched to the metric system it'd be up to a meter by now. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "In the name of the Pizza Lord. Charge!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Nay, but prithee, with sprinkles 'pon it instead," I said solemnly, "and frosting of white." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "We have now left Reason and Sanity Junction. Next stop, Looneyville." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Harry," Bob drawled, his eye lights flickering smugly, "what you know about women, I could juggle." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Likest thou jelly within thy doughnut?" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Kincaid! Bolshevik Muppet!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "If I need you I'll give you a signal.' 'What signal?' 'I'll imitate the scream of a terrified little girl" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "A succubus on the set. Strike that, the health-conscious kid sister made it two… succubuses. Succubusees? Succubi? Stupid Latin correspondence course." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I don't care about whose DNA has recombined with whose. When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching--they are your family." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "100 years ago, buying something you could make was considered wasteful; now making something you could buy is considered wasteful. I am not convinced this is a step in the right direction." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description:
"...the number one reason knitters knit is because they are so smart that they need knitting to make boring things interesting. Knitters are so compellingly clever that they simply can't tolerate boredom. It takes more to engage and entertain this kind of human, and they need an outlet or they get into trouble.
"...knitters just can't watch TV without doing something else. Knitters just can't wait in line, knitters just can't sit waiting at the doctor's office. Knitters need knitting to add a layer of interest in other, less constructive ways." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "There is practically no activity that cannot be enhanced or replaced by knitting, if you really want to get obsessive about it." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "I will always buy extra yarn. I will not try to tempt fate." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: " I will continue to freak out my children by knitting in public. It's good for them." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "Achieving the state of SABLE is not, as many people who live with these knitters believe, a reason to stop buying yarn, but for the knitter it is an indication to write a will, bequeathing the stash to an appropriate heir." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Dealing with the impossible, fantasy can show us what may be really possible. If there is grief, there is the possibility of consolation; if hurt, the possibility of healing; and above all, the curative power of hope. If fantasy speaks to us as we are, it also speaks to us as we might be" -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "We who make stories know that we tell lies for a living. But they are good lies that say true things, and we owe it to our readers to build them as best we can. Because somewhere out there is someone who needs that story. Someone who will grow up with a different landscape, who without that story will be a different person. And who with that story may have hope, or wisdom, or kindness, or comfort. And that is why we write." -- Neil Gaiman
